questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

Your company uses Microsoft Teams and has an auto attendant named AA1.

A user named User1 has a phone number of 613-555-1234.

You need to assign the phone number to AA1.

Which three actions should you perform in sequence in the Microsoft Teams admin center? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
The answer seems to be correct.
Logically thinking it should be as below
- unassign the user number
- convert the user number to service number
- assign the service number to AA

To convert the user number to service number key steps are as below 
1. go to TAC>Voice>Phone numbers
2.Create a new case 
3. In case type select "Inventory type change- change inventory type of my phone number(s)
4.Then in "Convert to" field select "service number"

Once case is actioned the user number will appear as service number and then it can be assigned to AA.
Thank goodness Microsoft finally gave administrators the ability to switch number type in TAC now!

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that uses Teams.

The sales department at your company requires that a toll-free number appear at the top of a list of numbers on Microsoft Outlook invites to Teams meetings.

Which four actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
To provide toll-free conference bridge phone numbers and to support conferencing dial-out to international phone numbers, you must set up Communications Credits for your organization.
Communication credits are rquired when setting up Audio conferencing:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/what-are-communications-credits

Service phone numbers for Calling Plans:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/getting-service-phone-numbers

Set up Audio Conferencing for Microsoft Teams:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/set-up-audio-conferencing-in-teams#step-7-assign-dial-in-phone-numbers-for-users-who-lead-meetings

Set the phone numbers included on invites in Microsoft Teams:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/set-the-phone-numbers-included-on-invites-in-teams#set-or-change-the-default-audio-conferencing-phone-number-for-a-meeting-organizer-or-user-individually

1. Purchase communication credits:
• Communication credits are required for purchasing and assigning service numbers.
2. Request a service number:
• After purchasing communication credits, you can request a service number that includes a toll-free number.
3. Assign a number to a conference bridge:
• Once you have obtained a service number, you need to assign it to a conference bridge.
4. Create and assign an audio conferencing policy:
• Finally, create an audio conferencing policy that includes the assigned toll-free number. Assign this policy to the relevant users or groups.
Should be N/Y/Y

comments.content:
the give answer is correct... NNY, because Guest inviter role can be added but you need to be an an owner of the team too. the settings are in O365 here at tenant level.. 
Go to your Microsoft Office 365 Admin Center
Go to Settings > Services & Add-Ins > Office 365 Groups
Turn on the settings for Let Group Members Outside The Organization Access Group Content and Let Group Owners Add People Outside The Organization To Groups

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/solutions/limit-who-can-invite-guests?view=o365-worldwide
I think you don't need to be also owner

discussion.content: User 2 as a member of the Team (which wasnt specified as private) and with a Guest inviter role should be able to invite guests to the team

NNY 

Guest Inviter can’t add user to group only invite so can’t add user to Project1 https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference#guest-inviter

Answer is NYY

Check this: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/external-id/external-collaboration-settings-configure

From the link, "Only users assigned to specific admin roles can invite guest users: To allow only those users with administrator roles to invite guests, select this radio button. The administrator roles include Global Administrator, User Administrator, and GUEST INVITER!"

And also, "With the GUEST INVITER role, you can give individual users the ability to invite guests without assigning them a global administrator or other admin role. Assign the Guest inviter role to individuals. Then make sure you set Admins and users in the guest inviter role can invite to Yes."

So, User2 is a GUEST INVITER but belong to an administrator role. So, Box 2 is Y!

Answer is correct.
No, No, Yes

User2 is a member only and therefore can not invite other members. But he can request adding a member.

quote from Microsoft:
If you're a team owner, you can add someone to a team. If you're not a team owner, you can submit a request and the team owner can then accept or deny it.

source:
https://support.microsoft.com/en-gb/office/add-members-to-a-team-in-microsoft-teams-aff2249d-b456-4bc3-81e7-52327b6b38e9
1. first adatum domain invite constraint 2.user3 is owner can invite 3. user2 is member cant invite
That is a ridiculiuss question. It takes 10 mins to read it and work it out.

Team Owner can archive using the Teams Client:
https://support.microsoft.com/en-au/office/archive-or-restore-a-team-dc161cfd-b328-440f-974b-5da5bd98b5a7

comments.content: There is no indicator that user 4 is an admin. So, how can he access the Admin center? Teams client is here the correct one

discussion.content:
Correct answers:

User4
Microsoft Teams Client

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/archive-or-delete-a-team :
Over time, a team created in Microsoft Teams might fall out of use or you might want to archive or delete a team at the end of a project. If you're a Microsoft Teams admin, follow the steps in this article to archive or delete a team that's no longer needed. (If you're a team owner, you can also archive a team.)....

and the link for the owner is:
https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/archive-or-restore-a-team-dc161cfd-b328-440f-974b-5da5bd98b5a7

So either Microsoft Teams admin or team owner which in this case is user4

comments.content: Correct! There is no indicator that user 4 is an admin. So, how can he access the Admin center? Teams client is here the correct one.

discussion.content:
Answer is correct. 
User4 does not have admin rights and can't access the TAC.

The Option to archive a team is almost hidden in the Teams Client.
Open the Teams list. Klick on the 3 dots on the top next to "Teams" and select "manage teams". Now you can see your Teams List on the right side. Choose a team where you're owner at and select the 3 dots on the right. You have the option "archive team".

comments.content: through this method you can only archive a channel not the whole team and in the question Projec1 is a team not a channel.

discussion.content: Also, second part should be "Teams Client" as the Owner could do it from there and wouldn't have access to TAC

comments.content: Why can I create an org wide team if I am only Teams admin then? I just tested.

discussion.content: "Only global admins can create org-wide teams and currently an org-wide team is limited to organizations with no more than 10,000 users. There's also a limit of five org-wide teams per tenant. If these requirements are met, global admins will see Org-wide as an option when they select to build a team From scratch when creating a team."

1 (limit of 5 includes archived teams)
Global admin only

Como administrador, puede crear y administrar equipos y canales en el cliente de Teams o en el centro de administración de Microsoft Teams. Puede crear los equipos como públicos o privados. También puede crear un equipo de toda la organización.
